content: Policies Retirement Investments CPF Asked by AnonymousAsked on 23 Oct 2018How much is the max that you can top up your Special Account (SA) to in your CPF? Would be interested to hear from experiences from the community?It's reaching the end of year and was wondering how to let my money compound further.1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 23 Oct 2018The max you can top up is up the to the FRS of the current year. So that's 171k this year. This is called the Retirement Sum Top Up Scheme.0 comments0
